Notes:

This is the first time Deep Purple's surviving BBC
Session recordings have been rounded up. Cutting
their first session even before their debut single
Hush was released in the summer of '68, the band
were frequently visitors to the BBC studios over the
next two years. Several of the versions here have
never been issued before, others were never recorded
elsewhere. The material (which at times is from less
than perfect surviving audio sources) ranges from
energetic guitar heavy versions of early tracks
through to a blistering set from the monumental In
Rock album. This 2CD set includes a detailed booklet
with full session details and history

Deep Purple are a British rock band formed in
Hertford in 1968. They are considered to be among
the pioneers of heavy metal and modern hard rock
although their musical approach changed over the
years. Originally formed as progressive rock band
the band's sound shifted to hard rock in 1970. Deep
Purple, together with Led Zeppelin and Black
Sabbath, have been referred to as the "unholy
trinity of British hard rock and heavy metal in the
early to mid-Seventies"
